review: The Fire TV is easy to install (providing you don't encounter wireless issues .... see below), intuitive to operate and stands out with excellent voice-recognition functionality. If you are invested in the Amazon eco-system, this is an excellent choice.Now, regarding the wireless issues - when I first tried to connect to my wireless network (as part of the install), it would not connect. This is the solution that worked for me (only because of the type of TV I have - Samsung):When I plugged in the HDMI cable to my Samsung LED TV, it automatically connected as HDMI-CEC (Anynet+). I had to turn OFF the Anynet+ feature of my TV and then I could connect to my wireless network (although this failed initially with 'unable to connect to amazon.com', but a reboot of my router - as many have reported doing - corrected the issue and all was well from that moment).
author: Kindle Customer

review: This small unit operates as advertised, is easy to use and provides great quality video signal.  The unit easily fits in the cabinet with my cable box, Blu-ray player and sound system.  I purchased this to replace the streaming capability of my Blu-ray player, which stopped working properly (although it still plays disks just fine).  One complication is that my sound system only has two optical inputs, and the Fire TV box would be the third, so I need an optical switch or new sound system.
